static tResult AddClass ( const tChar *  strID,
void *  pFactory 
)
static

Add an additional class and its classfactory to the reader, e.g.

in order to add more known sample types Call before the first call to create!!!

Parameters
strID[in] Identifier of class
pFactory[in] pointer to factory that creates the class
Returns
standard error code

static

in order to add more known sample types Call before the first call to create!!!

Parameters
strServiceFilename[in] filename of service to be loaded
Returns
standard error code
virtual tResult Close ( )
pure virtual

Closes the ADTF file.

The close method closes the dat file. Do not forget to call Release.

Returns
the standard result code.
static IADTFFileReader* Create ( )
static

Creates a dat file reader.

The function creates a dat file reader to access the data content of a dat file.

Returns
the interface to a dat file reader.
virtual tResult ExtractEDSDataFromDAT ( const tChar *  i_strDatFile,
const tChar *  i_strDestPath,
tInt32  i_nFlags = 0 
)
pure virtual

Extracts the EDS Data from a given DAT File to a Destination Dir.

Parameters
i_strDatFile[in] Full path with name of the containing DAT-file ('\0' terminated !)
i_strDestPath[in] Destination folder on a local file system, if the path is NULL the $TEMP$ macro will be used ('\0' terminated !)
i_nFlags[in] Additional flags
  • 0x00 default, nothing is deleted, files will be overwritten
  • 0x01 deletes the strDestPath before extracting
    handle with care if you set the value to 0x01. There may be occur some problems if the directory of i_strDestPath is otherwise in use.
Return values
ERR_INVALID_FILEi_strDatFile doesn't exist or the extraction of the file(s) failed
ERR_ACCESS_DENIEDi_strDatFile can't be opened
ERR_UNEXPECTEDno extension found
ERR_INVALID_ARGif one of the pointer is NULL (expect i_strDestPath)
OKif everything is OK
virtual tResult FindExtension ( const tChar *  strIdentifier,
const cADTFFileExtension **  ppExtension 
)
pure virtual

Gets the given extension content.

The content is contained in a class object named cADTFFileExtension.

Parameters
strIdentifier[in] Extension name.
ppExtension[out] Content of the extension. This pointer is only valid until the next call of GetExtension or FindExtension.
Returns
the standard result code.

virtual const tChar* GetGUID ( )
pure virtual

Get the GUID of the current file.

Returns
Either pointer to the beginning of 0-terminated string representing the GUID of the currently handled file or NULL in case no GUID exists.

the number of index entries.

virtual tResult GetStreamAdditionalData ( tUInt16  ui16StreamId,
const void **  ppData,
tSize *  pszSize,
tUInt32  ui32Flags = 0 
)
pure virtual

Get the additional data of a stream.

Parameters
ui16StreamId[in] ID of the stream
ppData[out] Address of a pointer to the additional data
pszSize[in] Size of ppData
ui32Flags[in] currently unused.
Return values
ERR_NOT_FOUNDThere is no additional data for the specified stream.
virtual tResult GetStreamCount ( tInt &  nStreamCount)
pure virtual

Get the number of valid streams contained in the dat file.

THIS DOES NOT IMPLY that these streams are tightly packed. It is possible that stream 1 exists, 2 does not, but 3 and 4 do.

Parameters
nStreamCount[out] pointer to int that will receive the number of streams
Returns
standard error code
virtual const tADTFStreamDescriptor* GetStreamDescriptor ( tUInt16  ui16StreamId)
pure virtual

Gets the Stream Description that describes the selected stream.

Parameters
ui16StreamId[in] the id of the selected stream, must be bigger than 0
Returns
the StreamDescription
virtual tResult GetStreamId ( const tChar *  strName,
tUInt16 &  ui16StreamId 
)
pure virtual

Find the stream id.

This function returns the stream id for the given name if exists.

Parameters
strName[in] name of stream, case sensitive.
ui16StreamId[out] id of stream with name strName.
Returns
ERR_NOERROR if strName was found.
ERR_UNKNOWN if strName was not found.
ERR_POINTER if strname is NULL.
virtual const tChar* GetStreamMediaDescription ( tUInt16  nStreamId,
tChar *  strDescBuffer = NULL,
tInt  szSizeOfBuffer = 0,
tUInt32  ui32Flags = MDF_StreamDescription 
)
pure virtual

Get the media description of a stream (for further information about the media description, see the data definition language documentation)

Parameters
nStreamId[in] ID of the stream
strDescBuffer[out] optional buffer to copy the media description into
szSizeOfBuffer[in] size of strDescBuffer
ui32Flags[in] flags to control what part to get from the media description
Returns
the media description for the corresponding stream but see remark
Return values
Ifthe stream is not found, it returns NULL.
Remarks
The return value is only valid until the next call of GetStreamMediaDescription !
virtual const tChar* GetStreamName ( tUInt16  nStreamId)
pure virtual

Seeks the stream name.

The function seek the stream name for the given handle if exists.

Parameters
nStreamId[in] ID of the stream
Returns
the stream name. if not found the return value will be NULL.
virtual tTimeStamp GetTimeDuration ( )
pure virtual

Gets the time duration.

The function retrieves the time the file is lasting.

Returns
the time.
virtual tResult Open ( const tChar *  strFileName)
pure virtual

Opens the ADTF file.

The adtf reader can open the dat file only in reading access mode. If a correspoding media description file (e.g. 'strFileName'.description) exits, this is also openend.

Parameters
strFileName[in] The Filename as null terminated string (relative or absolute path).
Returns
the standard result code.
virtual tResult Read ( cADTFDataBlock **  ppDataBlock)
pure virtual

Reads the next dat file content.

The content is contained in a class object named cADTFDataBlock. This function will increase the current dat file position. And return an internal pointer.

Parameters
ppDataBlock[in, out] Address of an pointer to an data block. The Pointer will be valid until the next fileoperation.
Returns
the standard result code.
virtual tResult Read ( cADTFDataBlock *  pDataBlock)
pure virtual

Reads the next dat file content.

The content is contained in a class object named cADTFDataBlock. This function will increase the current dat file position.

Parameters
pDataBlock[inout] Address of an user allocated data block.
Returns
the standard result code.
static tResult Release ( IADTFFileReader *  pReader)
static

Releases a dat file reader.

This function releases a dat file reader and deletes it.

Parameters
pReader[in,out] Pointer to reader object to release
Returns
the standard result code.
virtual tInt64 Seek ( tInt64  nDataBlockPos)
pure virtual

Seeks the DAT File.

The seek method jumps chunk with the given index. The next IADTFFileReader::Read call will read the specified chunk.

Parameters
nDataBlockPos[in] The index of the chunk (between 0 and chunk count).
Returns
the current chunk index.
virtual tInt64 Seek ( tUInt16  nStreamId,
tInt64  nDataBlockPos 
)
pure virtual

Seeks the DAT File.

The seek method jumps chunk in the current stream with the given index. The next IADTFFileReader::Read call will read the specified chunk.

Parameters
nStreamId[in] The ID of the stream to seek
nDataBlockPos[in] The index of the chunk (between 0 and chunk count).
Returns
the current chunk index.
virtual tInt64 SeekTime ( tTimeStamp  tmTimePos)
pure virtual

Seeks the DAT File.

The seek method jumps to the given time. The next IADTFFileReader::Read call will read the next chunk at or after the specified time.

Warning
IIndexedFileReader will crash if tmTimePos is smaller than the file offset.
Parameters
tmTimePos[in] The file time in micro seconds.
Returns
the current chunk index.
static tResult SetLogLevel ( tInt  nLogLevel)
static

Sets The global Loglevel.

By default the Loglevel is set to eLOG_LVL_DUMP

Parameters
[in]nLogLevelsee tLogLevel
Returns
Standard error code (see ADTF Error Codes)
Return values
